Text: Hey, I've downloaded and created the bootable pen with superduper but when trying to boot the PC doesn't recognize the Pen... What's going on?
Did you install the BootLoader that was given to you in the tools folder?
I'm using Windows 8 x64 but i cannot find superduper for windows. How can i restore the .dmg file..
DMG files are mac os images. You will need to use either a Hackint0sh or a mac computer to restore the image. I suggest getting a copy of vmware osx image.

Hey Realosxman. I've read your very brief Read Me but I'm unsure about the steps I need to take to do this whole thing. I've upgraded Leopard to Snow Leopard before bu a bootable thumb drive (format and restore via Disk Utility) but I don't know what you mean by "Restore .dmg using SuperDuper".. Do you mean "Copy" the .dmg to the already bootable thumb drive? And then what? Sorry, I don't find your 5 lines of instructions very comprehensive for someone who has only done this kind of thing once..
Managed to retrieve the files off the .dmg... and realise this whole thing isn't very noob friendly isn't it lol
